result.execSummary:
The defendant Tritan D. Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Request for hearing
Motion hearing on October 19, 2017 at 01:40 pm.
for Furlough s/BNB/9-21-17

Defendant Tritan D. Lee in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Tritan D. Lee in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant had written the court for a furlough.  Court did receive the letter and states why the first request was denied.  Atty Johnson states motion.  Atty Hendee responds to the motion and asks that if the court does grant the motion that the court do not give those furlough days as credit.  Atty Hendee requests GPS monitoring be done.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the furlough request for the following:  Defendant will be Released at 10:00am Thursday, Sept. 21st, 2017 and return to the jail by 7:00pm on Friday, Sept. 22nd, 2017.
Defendant is to pay the costs for GPS monitoring and will charge the device while on furlough
from Court to Tritan D Lee regarding Furlough request
to Court from Tritan D Lee regarding Furlough request
for repayment of Atty fees s/BNB/9-5-17
Invoice from Atty Johnson

Defendant Tritan D. Lee in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Possession of THC.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended charge.  Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 amended to Misd. of Possession of THC.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.

Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before August 29, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Dane County or Sauk County
Credit = 0 days
Court costs = $243.00
bond be applied
60 days to pay the balance
Repayment of Attorney fees; bill will be submitted by Atty Johnson
Payment Plan for Attorney fees:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2017

Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in review of the motions in liminie the State did not have any objection for the defendant not appearing today.  Atty Johnson argues #1 on motion.  Atty Hendee does not object to #1.
BY THE COURT:  Court grants the request of #1.

Atty Johnson argues #2.  Atty Hendee responds. 
BY THE COURT:  Court grants the request in #2; however, the State may ask for side bar and the court will hear argument on that issue.

Counsel has discussions on the rest of the motions in liminie.
Motion hearing on June 21, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Set for JT.

Defendant's Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion to Suppress and Dismiss

Motion Hearing 5/11/16
Reporter:  Jill Bartol
Exhibit 1 - Squad Video

Defendant Tritan D. Lee in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Defendant Tritan D. Lee in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has filed several motions through multiple Attorney's and states a brief outline of the motions.  Atty Hendee states that Atty Johnson has recently filed a motion.  
Court states that the defendant has wrote a motion for himself as well.  Atty Johnson agrees with the summation of the motions.

Deputy J.S. called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee. Exhibit 1 marked and offered by Atty Hendee; squad DVD.
Atty Johnson does not object.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 1 received.

Cross-examined by Atty Johnson.
Re-direct by Atty Hendee.
Witness excused.

BY THE COURT:  Court will review the video and sets briefing schedule.

Motion hearing on May 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tritan D. Lee in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Tritan D. Lee in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion to supress.  Atty Lawton states that he was gone last week and was unable to meet with the defendant.  Atty Lawton states that his client is unhappy and in speaking with the PD office, they are not going to appoint another Attorney.  Defendant agrees that he does not want Atty Lawton to represent him anymore. 

BY THE COURT:  Atty Lawton is excused from the case.
Reset

TRANSCRIPT OF PRELIMINARY HEARIN GHELD ON 1/20/16 - JILL BARTOL, REPORTER
Motion hearing at 03-14-2016 10:30 am

State files Information.  Defendant received the Information and waives it's reading.  Not Guilty plea entered.
BY THE COURT:  Set motion.  Bond continued.  The Court will also add an AKA of Tristan D. Lee.

Defendant Tritan D. Lee in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Defendant Tritan D. Lee in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states he has an AKA for Mr. Lee and will be requesting it be added to the case if probable cause is found.  Atty Hendee requests Court take note of certified JOC from Columbia County (05CM882)
J. Stolpa called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee.  Record to Reflect:  Witness identified the defendant.  Cross-examined by Atty Lawton.  Plaintiff rests.
Atty Hendee makes arguments.  Atty Lawton makes arguments.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing at 01-20-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Tritan D. Lee in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Defendant Tritan D. Lee in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Frank requests he be allowed to withdraw as counsel in this case.  States his client wishes him to withdraw as well.  BY THE COURT:  Court grants the request and will allow Atty Frank to withdraw.  
Court questions defendant.  Defendant will be working with the public defender to get new counsel.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will reset the preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

from Atty Hendee requesting reset on the Prelim; officer not available November 24th.  Ok'd by Judge.

Attorney Mark J. Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee received information from P&P that the defendant has an active warrant so the officers were called off for the Prelim.
Atty Gumz states that a motion to dismiss was filed in July on this matter.  Atty Gumz states that he has been in contact with his client and he is requesting new counsel and asks that this matter be reset.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized; stay for 5 days with conditions:
Defendant is to get new counsel and that new counsel is to appear in court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
